data.title: Best kept delivery secret in Federal Way
data.text: Yep, Pops delivers.  The food is home cooking style,  Pastas, Pizzas and more comfort foods.  When you become a regular they really go over the top with extras and excellent service.

data.title: Not as good as it was a month ago
data.text: Last two orders the food has tasted and looked different. It would still be good but not the 5 stars that it has been for the last 14 years. We eat here at least once a week.

data.title: Great delivery pizza
data.text: New to Federal Way area we have tried to find really good pizza that comes hot to our door. We previewed the Pop's menu on-line and placed our order. They have several dinner items besides pizza that look tempting as well as 8 or more on-line coupons to choose from. We got a large combination pizza and used a $3 off coupon (came in just under $20 with tax and delivery). Only 99 cents for delivery and we were able to charge it and give details directions on-line. The pizza arrived within 30 minutes or so and was piping H O T, that in itself is rare! Positives: pizza crust was crisp and ingredients fresh and hot. Delivery prompt and polite. Negatives: Skimpy on the sauce and spices. Would benefit from some "Italian seasonings and a thicker sauce. Overall: We will order again and request extra sauce.

data.title: Delicious Pizza
data.text: This pizza has the perfect combination of just the right amount of sauce and ingredients. We have had pizza delivery a few times and have never waited for very long. The pizza arrives hot and delicious. This is a nice departure from the run of the mill national chain pizza places. They also deliver some really good sandwiches. I strongly recommend this place for a pizza night.

data.title: Disappointed to say the least
data.text:
A friend referred us to this place so I was excited to try it. But no go. The pizza had hardly any sauce, the lasagna had no meat and mostly sauce. And my meatball sandwich was sauce less and tasted like microwaved meatballs. 
The anti pasta salad needed more meat and cheese.
I'm not one of those people that just wants a bunch of food for free but good Italian should be hearty. I will not go back. And I suggest you don't bother.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text:
We found Pop's because we parked in front of it while my daughter and I got our hair cut next door.  My wife and I didn't feel like cooking this particular night so we decided to grab a couple pizzas.  

Now I'm very picky when it comes to pizza. Pops does some things right and some things wrong in my opinion.  The pizza was better than 99% of the other places we've tried since moving to Federal Way but it wasn't 100% what I look for in pizza either. 

They did offer thin crust and that's important to me so that was good but their recipe for their dough was very salty.  The salt flavor nearly  over powers the flavor of the rest of the pie.  The sauce was good.  It had great flavor, I just wish there were a bit more of it on the pizza.  Next time I'll need to order extra sauce.  The cheese was good and spread nicely but they seem to have missed one of the cardinal rules of pizza making which is to spread the toppings all the way to the outside because they migrate while cooking.  The toppings were sparse on most of the pizza and piled up on the other parts.  

I ordered garlic on my pizza and was pleasantly surprised to have whole roasted cloves.  That is a nice touch but I noticed while we waited for our order that they use a conveyor style pizza oven and cook their pizza in round metal trays.  I personally don't care for this method of cooking.  The conveyor oven is fine, that's what I used at Round Table but in order to keep the dough from sticking, you usually have to grease the trays heavily and that makes the crust soggy which it was.  What good is thin crust if it's soggy?  

Anyway, I ate an entire large to myself over the time span of about 5 hours so it couldn't have been that bad. I'll probably order Pop's pizza again.  My wife had a salad and love it.  It was half portion and well worth the price.  

Thanks for reading

data.title: Takeout King of Federal Way
data.text: Everything I have had from Pops is delicious.  Love their pesto pasta and their polpettini meatball appetizer.  Only reason I rate 4/5 is because I wish they had more homemade desserts.

data.title: Don't let the outside fool you
data.text: I was in town on business and wanted pizza. Found this place with good reviews so gave it a try and am glad I did! Owner Mario took my walk in order (I got the house special pizza) and it was outstanding. He said it was a popular item. Took 10 mins to make it. Mario proudly opened the box to display its contents for me with a smile. Don't let the outside of the place keep you from stopping by. Warm staff and great food await!

data.title: Delicious and Delivery
data.text: First let me point out their delivery fee was .99!  Compare that to other places and it makes it even more appealing!  We ordered an Italian sandwich, cheese bread, and a Caesar salad. It was all DELICIOUS!  The delivery driver was also very nice. You can order online, pay with your debit/credit card and have it delivered to your hotel...when you are tired it is a nice option to going out!  We will try pasta or pizza next time because we will definitely order from them again!

data.title: Pop's is great!
data.text: Pop's is a place that we had been meaning to try.  We would pass by it and see it there, behind Jack In The Box and we'd say we need to try it.  Finally, we did a few months ago and we love it.  The pizza is GREAT. The peperoni is crispy and just all around great.  The only thing I would not recommend is the tiramisu.  It was just ok.  but the pizza is awesome! I think it's a tiy bit greasy but so delicious! The pizza is consistently awesome and they have good customer service. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

data.title: Gluten Free Crust!!
data.text: I was in heaven when I heard this pizza place had gluten free crust! It was amazing! really good pizza and really friendly staff. I work at a hotel in the area and I always direct our guests to this pizza place!! You will not be dissapointed.

data.title: Not too bad
data.text:
Hard to go bad on a pizza anywhere, but this was a bit above average with a need for more to make it a top ten. 
Hard to find hole in the wall but worth the effort. I look forward to trying more next trip.
